intro: Braya humilis var. abbei, commonly known as the dwarf rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically features dense clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are usually small, rounded, and covered in fine hairs, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
